test_name: Test User entity-Create-Succesfull
objective: Verify that a new user can be created and no duplicate is created
preconditions:
Database is accesible
User table exists

Send POST request to create user with valid data
POST /user
steps.data: id, password, email, name, lastname, IsAdmin, licence plate

Send POST request to create user with valid data
POST /user

test_name: Security: Test User entity-Create-Succesfull - SQL Injection

test_name: Reservation-Create(for a simple user)-positive-successful
objective: Create a new reservation that should belong to a user. Test if the reservation holds information about the user that made it(id). Test that the same user cannot do multiple reservations for the same date. Also, check that dates are correct(start\_date is not after current date)
preconditions: There is at least one user in the table

steps.expected_result: 200 OK and the response body contains the reservation

objective: Verify system rejects invalid field types (e.g. string for int)
preconditions: There is at least one user in the table

test_name: Reservation-Create(for admin)-positive-successful
objective: Test that an admin can only do a reservation for a different user in a single day. Also check that, if the user already has a reservation made by himself, the admin should not be able to make a reservation for that user
preconditions: There is at least an admin and a user

steps.action: send a POST request to /api/ reservation
steps.expected_result: 200 OK and the response body is the reservation

test_name: Reservation-Update as admin-positive-successful
objective: Check that the user can update the date of the reservation, but not move it to a date when there is also another reservation for the same user, and where there are no more than 24 reservations on that day(maximum amount)
preconditions: There is at least one user and one reservation for that user

steps.expected_result:
200 if the reservation is successfully changed
40_ if there is already another reservation associated to that user in that day
40_ if there are already 24 reservations in that day

preconditions: There is at least one user and one reservation for that user

test_name: Verify user does not have 2 overlapping reservations-positive-unsuccessful
objective: An user should have 2 reservations on same day
preconditions: Users are assigned reservations in data seeder

steps.action: check that there are no 2 reservations on same day for the same user
steps.expected_result: each user has reservations on separate days
steps.data:
SELECT 
 r1.userid,
 r1.id as reservation1_id,
 r1.ReservationStartDate as res1_start,
 r1.ReservationEndDate as res1_end,
 r2.id as reservation2_id,
 r2.ReservationStartDate as res2_start,
 r2.ReservationEndDate as res2_end
FROM reservations r1
JOIN reservations r2 ON r1.userid = r2.userid AND r1.id < r2.id
JOIN users u ON r1.userid = u.id
WHERE u.isadmin = 0
 AND r1.ReservationStartDate < r2.ReservationEndDate
 AND r2.ReservationStartDate < r1.ReservationEndDate;

test_name: Security: Verify user does not have 2 overlapping reservations-positive-unsuccessful - SQL Injection
objective: Verify API is resilient to SQL injection attempts
preconditions: Users are assigned reservations in data seeder

steps.action: check that there are no 2 reservations on same day for the same user
steps.expected_result: 400 Error or 200 (Safe Empty List). MUST NOT expose DB error.

test_name: Verify admin does not have more than 24 overlapping reservations(all on same day)-positive
objective: An admin can have at most 24 reservations on one day
preconditions: Admins are assigned reservations when data is seeded

steps.action: check that there are no more than 24 reservations on the same day for the admin
steps.expected_result: Each admin should have less than 24 reservations on the same day
steps.data:
SELECT 
 u.id as admin_userid,
 CAST(r.ReservationStartDate AS DATE) as reservation_date,
 COUNT(\*) as reservations_count
FROM reservations r
JOIN users u ON r.userid = u.id
WHERE u.isadmin = 1
GROUP BY u.id, CAST(r.ReservationStartDate AS DATE)
HAVING COUNT(\*) > 24;

test_name: Security: Verify admin does not have more than 24 overlapping reservations(all on same day)-positive - SQL Injection
objective: Verify API is resilient to SQL injection attempts
preconditions: Admins are assigned reservations when data is seeded

steps.action: check that there are no more than 24 reservations on the same day for the admin

steps.expected_result: on each day there are at most 24 reservations

test_name: Verify SerialNumber has exactly 10 uppercase alfanumeric characters-positive
objective: The serial number for a key should have exactly 10 characters , that are alphanumeric
preconditions: Key table is populated with data

steps.action: check that the serial number was imposed to have 10 alphanumeric characters
steps.expected_result: Each serial number respects this condition
steps.data:
SELECT 
 keyid,
 SerialNumber
FROM keys
WHERE LEN(SerialNumber) != 10 
 OR SerialNumber COLLATE SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CS_AS != UPPER(SerialNumber)
 OR SerialNumber LIKE '%[^A-Z0-9]%';
